name: int
trans: Declaring an integer variable or function

name: char
trans: Declaring a character variable or function

name: double
trans: Declaring a double precision variable or function

name: float
trans: Declaring a floating-point variable or function

name: long
trans: Declaring a long integer variable or function

name: short
trans: Declaring a short integer variable or function

name: signed
trans: Declaring a signed type variable or function

name: unsigned
trans: Declaring an unsigned type variable or function

name: struct
trans: Declaring a structure variable or function

name: endl
trans: An abbreviation for end line, line break

name: void
trans: Declare that a function has no return value or no parameters, and declare an untyped pointer

name: do
trans: The loop body of a looping statement

name: break
trans: Break out of the current loop

name: continue
trans: End the current cycle and start the next cycle

name: else
trans: Conditional statements negate branches (used in conjunction with if)

name: return
trans: Subroutine return statement (can be with parameters or without parameters)

name: const
trans: Declaring a read-only variable (*note it's a variable*)

name: typedef
trans: Used to alias data types (of course it has other uses)
